title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)
description: Light in color, this is an earthy wine with its undergrowth flavors and red fruits that are becoming mature. It is a soft wine, the tannins gently cushioned by the fruit and plum feel of the wine. This is ready to drink.

title: Edetària 2014 Via Edetana Red (Terra Alta)
description: A rustic-smelling nose is low on fresh, clean fruit and heavy on tarry notes of black olive and asphalt. Tight and tannic in feel, primarily along the edges of the palate, this Garnacha-Syrah-Carignan blend remains tarry and burnt on the flavor profile, with bitter chocolate and herbal accents. A leafy tasting, peppery finish fails to fully make up for the wine's weak spots.

title: Impostino 2011 Viandante Riserva  (Montecucco)
description: This opens with aromas of leafy underbrush, wet earth, cellar floor and a whiff of stewed fruit. The dense palate is already evolved, showing dried black cherry, game and walnut before a short bitter finish.

title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Domaine de la Garenne  (Macon-Bussières)
description: The wine comes from just under an acre of vines in a village well into the hills west of Mâcon. It has a nutty quality with some ripe pear flavors. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)
description: With grapes coming from a wide range of vineyards, this is an immediately drinkable and fruity wine. It has soft tannins and juicy red berries that are bright with acidity and nutty flavors. Drink now.

title: Oak Grove 2014 Family Reserve Chardonnay (California)
description: This light and pleasing wine smells like apples and pistachios, and tastes mildly fruity and nicely crisp.

title: Rémy-Pannier 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This crisp, clean, lightly herbal wine has apple and grapefruit flavors that come through intense acidity. Bright with ripe fruit, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Replica 2014 Just Right Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This oak bomb of a wine smells like charred wood, wood smoke and black pepper. It tastes much the same, with a lingering charred finish. Medium to full bodied, it holds only a modest core of fruit.

title: Rooster Hill 2014 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Dusty minerals, smoke and pollen notes lend an earthy tone to ripe pineapple, tangerine and lemon flavors in this dry Riesling. It's a bit rustic in style, but fresh citrus acidity and a bristling of lime pith brightens the finish. Drink now through 2019.

title: Fabre Montmayou 2015 Rosé (Mendoza)
description: The difference between this and the brand new 2016 is obvious: this is maderized but still good. Aromas of orange blossom are floral, but overall this seems low on crispness. Plump on the palate, this tastes of peach and dried melon. A soft finish with a white-pepper character says drink right away.

title: Fazeli Cellars 2012 Ferdowski Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)
description: Cigar box, dried blueberry, toasted juniper and walnut show on the nose of this bottling. The cedar notes also extend to the palate, where dried fruit and leather flavors show.

title: Montemar 2013 Gran Reserva Assemblage Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Gritty aromas of black olive and road tar rest heavily atop herbal berry scents. This mystery blend is tight and tannic as nails. Blackened flavors of gritty blackberry, clove and wood spice finish rough and scratchy.

title: Picket Fence 2014 Miller Creek Vineyard Malbec (Alexander Valley)
description: Juicy brick tar and a sumptuous offering of blueberry and blackberry pie characterize this medium-bodied, softly approachable and easygoing red. Hints of smoky oak and dried herb lurk in the background.

title: Pisano 2013 Cisplatino Tannat-Merlot (Progreso)
description: Edgy, spicy and slightly green aromas suggest bell pepper and preserved Italian red pepper. A tight mouthfeel frames herbal flavors of plum, spice and tomato that carry over to the finish. This is 60% Tannat and 40% Merlot.

title: Replica 2015 Knockoff Chardonnay (California)
description: Made in an overtly oaky manner, this wine imitates the big barrel-fermented style pretty well. It has smoky, buttery aromas, good pear and peach flavors and a smooth, soft texture.

title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2015 Closerie des Alisiers  (Bourgogne)
description: This is an attractively ripe wine that shows the richness of the vintage well. It has yellow fruits along with touches of sultana and sliced apple. The wine is fruity, soft and ready to drink.

title: Robert Renzoni 2013 Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)
description: Very hoppy and herbal on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of dried blueberry, wet gravel and leather. The palate combines underripe blackberries with asphalt and espresso flavors. Too tightly structured now, it needs more time to develop.

title: Rooster Hill 2015 Estate Grown and Produced Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: While the nose is a touch brambly, profoundly ripe blackberry and cherry flavors are ruddy, almost pulpy on the palate of this plush juicy wine. Soft acidity and even softer tannins contribute to its easy-drinking style. Drink now through 2019.

title: Quara 2014 Special Selection Malbec (Cafayate)
description: Floral raspberry aromas are jammy and funky, like many Cafayate Malbecs are prone to be. This feels juicy but high in acidity, so it's pointy on the palate. Exotic plum and raspberry flavors follow the nose, while the finish is fresh, high in acidity and low on cushion.

title: Hector Wine Company 2014 Gewürztraminer (Seneca Lake)
description: Whiffs of potpourri florals, orange rind and pressed pears lend a musky tone to this deep golden Gewürztraminer. Soft acidity accentuates its robust body and texture. Bold alcohol lends a sizzle of heat to the finish.

title: Jones of Washington 2012 Jack's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Ancient Lakes)
description: The aromas suggest notes of green herbs, vanilla, freshly hewn wood and cherry. The flavors are lighter in style, with the tannins bringing some grit.

title: San Giuseppe 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella
description: Bracing and full-bodied, this offers dried sour cherry, raisin and licorice flavors alongside raspy tannins that clench the finish. Give the tannins another few years to unwind then drink up before the remaining fruit disappears.

title: Spiriterra 2014 Estate Muscadine (Napa Valley)
description: Described on the label as off dry, this rare Muscadine is dark golden-honey in color, with foxy, tart aromas that speak to the varietal. Light bodied, it offers a wisp of stone fruit and sour lemon.

title: Domaine Maestracci 2015 E Prove Rosé (Corse Calvi)
description: This peppery, fruit-flavored wine has a ripe character and wild strawberry flavors. Drink this full, spicy wine now.

title: Lone Birch 2015 Riesling (Yakima Valley)
description: Light aromas of white flowers and freshly cut pear lead to off-dry fruit flavors, with the concentration seeming a bit wanting.

title: Los Clop 2012 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of cedar, vanilla and cassis are the best part of this hard, clampy, ultratannic Cabernet. Flavors of vanilla and coconut soften and enrich screechy plum and red-berry fruit, while this finishes with a dominating narrow, tartaric feel.

title: Lazzeretti 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: This opens with aromas of wild cherry, violet and an earthy whiff of truffle. The aromas carry over to the palate along with a hint of clove, sage and a gamey note. Racy acidity and close-grained tannins leave a somewhat gravelly, drying finish.

title: Lion-Gri 2015 Golden Land Dry Merlot (Moldova)
description: This Moldovan Merlot has aromas of eucalyptus, dark chocolate and raspberry with flavors of cherry, black plum and a touch of baking spices. There's a nice minty lift in the midpalate, with a bright fruit finish and persistent tannins.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Bourgogne Aligoté)
description: Apart from being part of a sparkling wine blend, Aligoté is found in the Côte Chalonnaise where it produces ripe full wines. They have a delicious crisp green fruit and floral character. It is a wine to drink young and fruity, so drink now.

title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Côte Chalonnaise)
description: This is a light, crisp and fruity wine. Full of ripe green plums and crisp acidity, it is a wine that is all fruit. A light touch of minerality gives texture and complements the refreshing, floral aftertaste. Drink this wine now.
